SENT.plain: A case of lupus anticoagulant and repeated fetal loss with a successful delivery of a healthy baby after transfer of thawed frozen embryos and intravenous immunoglobulin administration is described
The repeated fetal loss was due to vascular disturbances caused by lupus anticoagulants
Anticoagulants and/or steroids did not help in further establishing pregnancy
Intravenous immunoglobulin combined with heparin and aspirin led to term pregnancy and the birth of a healthy child
